channel.title: Getting Xampp to work
channel.description:
Well, I installed Lampp (Xampp for linux) and it's working..I just need to know how to get it to connect from something like mybevil.kicks-ass.net (my dyndns) and it just instantly says
[code]Unable to connect
Firefox can't establish a connection to the server at mybevil.kicks-ass.net.
* The site could be temporarily unavailable or too busy. Try again in a few moments.
* If you are unable to load any pages, check your computer's network connection.
* If your computer or network is protected by a firewall or proxy, make sure that Firefox is permitted to access the Web.[/code]
anyone know whats wrong?
btw, I have port 80 forwarded on UDP and TCP, because I didn't know which to do lmfao

@Bang_Train wrote:

I KNOW SIMS lol

im giving him another something to try to get his to work

Read full topic

item.title: Getting Xampp to work
item.dc:creator: @S_ms S!ms
item.description:
@S_ms wrote:

[quote=“Bang Train, post:12, topic:82868”]my ISP doesnt give me a dynamic ip

but my local ip

i.e. 192.168.1.50

will change sometimes so i have it set to always be .50[/quote]

connection properties -> TCP/IP settings -> add a default IP

Read full topic

item.title: Getting Xampp to work
item.dc:creator: @kloplop321 kloplop321
item.description:
@kloplop321 wrote:

I use dynDns, just use a web hop. it works for me, cloak the URL. that is how I did it.

Read full topic

item.title: Getting Xampp to work
item.dc:creator: @Bang_Train Bang Train
item.description:
@Bang_Train wrote:

[quote=“Evil_, post:9, topic:82868”][quote author=S!ms link=topic=121756.msg1193476#msg1193476 date=1177198113]
http://mybevil.kicks-ass.net:80

did you added a vhost?
[/quote]
Nope, I don’t think =/

[quote author=Bang Train link=topic=121756.msg1194576#msg1194576 date=1177208654]
go to httpd.conf

and u should find somethign like

Listen 80

change to 80 to like say 49154 (mine)

and then when u go to ur ip
make it
65.644.354.35:49154 (use ur ip)
[/quote]It didn’t work

Maybe it’s just not meant to be? :’([/quote]

make sure u restart apache after[br][size=1]Posted on: April 22, 2007, 08:59:47 AM[/size][hr]and ull need a static ip on ur router instead of a dynamic ip

but u run linux so donno how to achieve this[br][size=1]Posted on: April 22, 2007, 09:00:55 AM[/size][hr]and turn off firewall when testing

Read full topic

change to 80 to like say 49154 (mine)

and then when u go to ur ip

Maybe it’s just not meant to be? :’(

item.title: Getting Xampp to work
item.dc:creator: @kloplop321 kloplop321
item.description:
@kloplop321 wrote:

hey, that is a great idea! I might try that![br][size=1]Posted on: April 21, 2007, 05:15:55 PM[/size][hr]DUDE It works!!! I can finally show people my projects(with pinging) to people without it timing out for others! Thankyou Bang Train! If I had enough rep, I would rep you ++++++!! THANKYOU!!! [center]

Thumbs_up.jpg864×1234
[/center]
wow, a little bigger than I expected :rolleyes:

Read full topic
